channel.title: Can this be done?
channel.description:
ok play rsps on ipod/iphone/ipad
i donno if it can be done but its worth a try all credits to me for thinking it lol if it works please give me credit as well
ok first you have to have ur server and it has to be a webclient([url=http://www.webs.com]www.webs.com[/url]) 2nd go to [url=http://www.dudamobile.com/]http://www.dudamobile.com/[/url] <-- make your forum aper idevices you have to have the device(s) jail broken and download java and there you go
let me know if it works for you???

item.title: Can this be done?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

Lol that being said… I have been able to get a PI client to run on my Ipad after I jail broke it, if it can run on a mac it can run on an ipod.

can i get pics and steps on how you did this? just for proof. i have no reason to say this is false. i would just like to see it. even though photos and videos dont always prove anything since they can easily be edited. anyways nice if you did. how was the game play btw? you may want to look at the specs on an ipad and iphone/ipod touch though but they both do run the same OS–iOS, and by the looks of it they have nearly the same specs in reference to RAM, GFX, and CPU.

item.title: Can this be done?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

xryz:

… why pay for something you can get for free? …

This statement assumes that both products are equal in what they provide. so yes if you want something more than what you can get for free, then yes buy what you need. my point is if you can get it cheaper then why pay more? Just to say, “hey, look i bought something that cost more than what its worth!”?

item.title: Can this be done?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

here is what i found on a google search. http://www.iphonefaq.org/archives/9731 but according to this page you can you can http://iphoneroot.com/tutorial-install-java-on-the-iphone/ also here http://www.taranfx.com/how-to-install-compile-run-java-apps-on-iphone . i personally dont know how well this will work and as far as i know you would need a browser plugin to use a web client. there are a lot of factors though in play to play runescape on a mobile device. the client may have to be “crippled” i havent read those pages but you need a plugin like i mentioned, im going to guess you can get a different web browser than just safari, not sure though. i really dont know all the thinks apple does with their software but im pretty sure they are close to windows making you have to do and use what they say you have to, its mostly about money and not to much about the customers. the client uses a lot of resources(its a 3d game) im sure you could make it use less resources but like i said it probably will be crippled. this jvm provided from those guide idk what all they include; if its just console based apps or if you can do 3d and gui stuff. and i agree with xavier webs isnt the best thing to use but its simple, its really a matter of what you know how to use and what you need to use. if you need more than just like 50mb of storage then webs.com isnt what you need. if you need something more than just a basic website host then dont use webs.com . its pretty simple to set up a page on webs.com but its the basics sure you can use js and java and other things and use external file storage but others places can make it simpler and more secure.

Read full topic

item.title: Can this be done?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

have you tested this or are those steps ideas? last i knew they still didnt have java for apple portable devices. i cant really try this b/c i dont have one. you can play runescape or do other java things but not like you would want to. the only way i know that you can do this is through a remote desktop application. which i have used on my wii to play runescape. you have to have the setting set right to even make it playable on the wii. the only vnc client that i know works with the wii is an ajax client. which maybe able to work fast but right then it was slow over a WLAN. iphone and stuff you can use a regular vnc client im pretty sure they have apps there for it, b/c they have vnc android apps. i also played rs on my phone through vnc, and if my phone was faster i could play it without needing computer; since i can run ubuntu on my phone but i would still have to use the vnc client to see the ubuntu desktop on my phone. if java is still not available for portable apple devices then it probable will be awhile til you can; last i read apple didnt want oracle(sun Microsystems then) to make a java for said devices b/c it is a “bad”(not the word(s) used but that a summary of what steve jobs said, or at least what i remember reading) language.

Read full topic
